p: The effectiveness of the hydroalcoholic extract of Phoenix dactylifera leaves was evaluated in an animal model of type II diabetes. The postprandial hyperglycemia level was decreased in plasma glucose after 60 min of administration of 20 mg/kg of the extract, which was similar to the acarbose 50 mg/kg effect, while the oral administration of the extract (20 mg/kg) for 28 days in alloxan diabetic mice showed a more significant antidiabetic activity than that of acarbose [ 134].
